Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.actor

Class Behavior

java.lang.Object
it.unipr.sowide.actodes.actor.Behavior
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Buffer, BusyFork, Client, Consumer, EatingPhilosopher, Entity, Executor, Explorer, Fibonacci, FreeFork, HungryPhilosopher, Initiator, Initiator, Initiator, Manager, Master, Mobile, Mover, Processor, Producer, Provider, Receiver, Receiver, Responder, Responder, Sender, Sender, Sender, Sensor, Server, Shutdown, StateBuffer, ThinkingPhilosopher, Worker
public abstract class Behavior
extends Object
implements Serializable
The Behavior class provides a partial implementation of an actor behavior.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • PROVIDER

      public static final Reference PROVIDER
      Actor space service provider reference.

    • EXECUTOR

      public static final Reference EXECUTOR
      Actor space executor actor reference.

    • SPACE

      public static final Reference SPACE
      Actor space broadcast reference. It is used for sending a message to all the actors of the actor space.

    • APP

      public static final Reference APP
      Application broadcast reference. It is used for sending a message to all the actors of an application.

    • ACCEPTALL

      public static final MessagePattern ACCEPTALL
      Message pattern that accepts any message.

    • START

      public static final MessagePattern START
      Message pattern for matching the starting behavior message.

    • KILL

      public static final MessagePattern KILL
      Message pattern for matching a kill message.

    • TIMEOUT

      public static final MessagePattern TIMEOUT

    • DESTROYER

      public static final MessageHandler DESTROYER
      A handler that processes a kill message performing the shutdown of the actor. Notes that it does not send a reply to the kill request message.

    • DUMMY

      public static final MessageHandler DUMMY
      A dummy handler.

    • CYCLE

      public static final MessagePattern CYCLE
      Message pattern matching a cycle message received from the scheduling actor. Note such kind of message is usually sent by the executors for passive actors.

  • Constructor Details

    • Behavior

      protected Behavior()
      Class constructor.

    • Behavior

      protected Behavior​(BehaviorState i, BehaviorState[] s)
      Class constructor.
      Parameters:
      i - the initial behavior state.
      s - the possible behavior states.

  • Method Details

    • cases

      public abstract void cases​(CaseFactory c)
      It must define the message pattern - message handler pairs (cases) that drive the execution of the behavior.
      Parameters:
      c - the case factory.

    • configure

      public void configure​(Actor a)
      Configures the behavior.
      Parameters:
      a - the actor. Note that the operation fails if an actor is already bound to a behavior instance.

    • getReference

      public Reference getReference()
      Gets the reference of the actor.
      Returns:
      the reference.

    • getParent

      public Reference getParent()
      Gets the reference of the parent actor.
      Returns:
      the reference.

    • getStates

      public BehaviorState[] getStates()
      Gets the possible actor states.
      Returns:
      the possible actor states or null if the actor does not move from a set of different states.

    • getState

      public BehaviorState getState()
      Gets the actor state.
      Returns:
      the current actor state or null if the actor does not move from a set of different states.

    • setState

      public void setState​(BehaviorState s)
      Sets the actor state.
      Parameters:
      s - the actor state.

    • actor

      public Reference actor​(Behavior b)
      Creates a new actor.
      Parameters:
      b - the behavior.
      Returns:
      the reference of new actor or null if the creation of the actor failed.

    • send

      public void send​(Reference r, Object c)
      Sends an one-way message to an actor. Note that the sender does not receive any information about the successful reception of the message.
      Parameters:
      r - the destination reference.
      c - the message content.

    • send

      public void send​(List<Reference> l, Object c)
      Sends an one-way message to an actor. Note that the sender does not receive any information about the successful reception of the message.
      Parameters:
      l - the list of destination references.
      c - the message content.

    • send

      public void send​(Message m, Object c)
      Sends an one-way message as reply to another message. Note that the message is sent only if the incoming message requires an answer. Moreover, the sender does not receive any information about the successful reception of the message.
      Parameters:
      m - the message to be replied.
      c - the message content.

    • future

      public void future​(Reference a, Object c, MessageHandler p)
      Sends a two-way message to another actor. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
      Parameters:
      a - the destination reference.
      c - the message content.
      p - the reply processing handler. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the destination is not reachable or cannot manage the message.
      See Also:
      Error

    • future

      public void future​(Reference a, Object c, long t, MessageHandler p)
      Sends a two-way message to another actor. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
      Parameters:
      a - the destination reference.
      c - the message content.
      t - the reply reception timeout.
      p - the reply processing handler. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the destination is not reachable, cannot manage the message or the timeout fires before the reception of the reply.
      See Also:
      Error

    • future

      public void future​(Message m, Object c, MessageHandler p)
      Sends a two-way message as reply to an another message. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
      Parameters:
      m - the message to be replied.
      c - the message content.
      p - the reply processing handler. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the incoming message does not require an answer, the destination is not reachable or cannot manage the message.
      See Also:
      Error

    • future

      public void future​(Message m, Object c, long t, MessageHandler p)
      Sends a two-way message as reply to an another message. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
      Parameters:
      m - the message to be replied.
      c - the message content.
      t - the reply reception timeout.
      p - the reply processing handler. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the incoming message does not require an answer, the destination is not reachable, cannot manage the message or the timeout fires before the reception of the reply.
      See Also:
      Error

    • onReceive

      public void onReceive​(MessagePattern p, MessageHandler h)
      Processes an incoming message that satisfies a specific message pattern.
      Parameters:
      p - the message pattern.
      h - the message processing handler. Note that the actor does not stop itself for waiting for the message. Moreover, such a message pattern - message handler pair manages a single message (i.e., it is removed after the processing of a message).

    • onReceive

      public void onReceive​(MessagePattern p, long t, MessageHandler h)
      Processes either an incoming message that satisfies a specific message pattern or an error message if the timeout fires.
      Parameters:
      p - the message pattern.
      t - the message reception timeout.
      h - the message processing handler. Note that the actor does not stop itself for waiting for the message. Moreover, such a message pattern - message handler pair manages a single message (i.e., it is removed after the processing of a message).

    • log

      public Serializable log()
      Provides information about the current behavior.
      Returns:
      the information. This method returns null and must be overridden to provides some information about the current behavior.
